intro: Goniothalamus gitingensis, commonly known as the Giting Mountain tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland to montane forest areas, often in humid and shaded environments. Its flowers are bisexual and have a unique structure with numerous stamens and a superior ovary. The fruit is a berry that matures to a dark red color, containing several seeds.
